003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.util.datalog;
006
007/**
008 * A data log. The log file is created immediately upon construction with a temporary filename. The
009 * file may be renamed at any time using the setFilename() function.
010 *
011 * <p>The data log is periodically flushed to disk. It can also be explicitly flushed to disk by
012 * using the flush() function.
013 */
014@SuppressWarnings({"PMD.TooManyMethods", "PMD.ExcessivePublicCount"})
015public final class DataLog implements AutoCloseable {
016  /**
017   * Construct a new Data Log. The log will be initially created with a temporary filename.
018   *
019   * @param dir directory to store the log
020   * @param filename filename to use; if none provided, a random filename is generated of the form
021   *     "wpilog_{}.wpilog"
022   * @param period time between automatic flushes to disk, in seconds; this is a time/storage
023   *     tradeoff
024   * @param extraHeader extra header data
025   */
026  public DataLog(String dir, String filename, double period, String extraHeader) {
027    m_impl = DataLogJNI.create(dir, filename, period, extraHeader);
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Construct a new Data Log. The log will be initially created with a temporary filename.
032   *
033   * @param dir directory to store the log
034   * @param filename filename to use; if none provided, a random filename is generated of the form
035   *     "wpilog_{}.wpilog"
036   * @param period time between automatic flushes to disk, in seconds; this is a time/storage
037   *     tradeoff
038   */
039  public DataLog(String dir, String filename, double period) {
040    this(dir, filename, period, "");
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Construct a new Data Log. The log will be initially created with a temporary filename.
045   *
046   * @param dir directory to store the log
047   * @param filename filename to use; if none provided, a random filename is generated of the form
048   *     "wpilog_{}.wpilog"
049   */
050  public DataLog(String dir, String filename) {
051    this(dir, filename, 0.25);
052  }
053
054  /**
055   * Construct a new Data Log. The log will be initially created with a temporary filename.
056   *
057   * @param dir directory to store the log
058   */
059  public DataLog(String dir) {
060    this(dir, "", 0.25);
061  }
062
063  /** Construct a new Data Log. The log will be initially created with a temporary filename. */
064  public DataLog() {
065    this("");
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Change log filename.
070   *
071   * @param filename filename
072   */
073  public void setFilename(String filename) {
074    DataLogJNI.setFilename(m_impl, filename);
075  }
076
077  /** Explicitly flushes the log data to disk. */
078  public void flush() {
079    DataLogJNI.flush(m_impl);
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Pauses appending of data records to the log. While paused, no data records are saved (e.g.
084   * AppendX is a no-op). Has no effect on entry starts / finishes / metadata changes.
085   */
086  public void pause() {
087    DataLogJNI.pause(m_impl);
088  }
089
090  /** Resumes appending of data records to the log. */
091  public void resume() {
092    DataLogJNI.resume(m_impl);
093  }
094
095  /**
096   * Start an entry. Duplicate names are allowed (with the same type), and result in the same index
097   * being returned (start/finish are reference counted). A duplicate name with a different type
098   * will result in an error message being printed to the console and 0 being returned (which will
099   * be ignored by the append functions).
100   *
101   * @param name Name
102   * @param type Data type
103   * @param metadata Initial metadata (e.g. data properties)
104   * @param timestamp Time stamp (may be 0 to indicate now)
105   * @return Entry index
106   */
107  public int start(String name, String type, String metadata, long timestamp) {
108    return DataLogJNI.start(m_impl, name, type, metadata, timestamp);
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Start an entry. Duplicate names are allowed (with the same type), and result in the same index
113   * being returned (start/finish are reference counted). A duplicate name with a different type
114   * will result in an error message being printed to the console and 0 being returned (which will
115   * be ignored by the append functions).
116   *
117   * @param name Name
118   * @param type Data type
119   * @param metadata Initial metadata (e.g. data properties)
120   * @return Entry index
121   */
122  public int start(String name, String type, String metadata) {
123    return start(name, type, metadata, 0);
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Start an entry. Duplicate names are allowed (with the same type), and result in the same index
128   * being returned (start/finish are reference counted). A duplicate name with a different type
129   * will result in an error message being printed to the console and 0 being returned (which will
130   * be ignored by the append functions).
131   *
132   * @param name Name
133   * @param type Data type
134   * @return Entry index
135   */
136  public int start(String name, String type) {
137    return start(name, type, "");
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Finish an entry.
142   *
143   * @param entry Entry index
144   * @param timestamp Time stamp (may be 0 to indicate now)
145   */
146  public void finish(int entry, long timestamp) {
147    DataLogJNI.finish(m_impl, entry, timestamp);
148  }
149
150  /**
151   * Finish an entry.
152   *
153   * @param entry Entry index
154   */
155  public void finish(int entry) {
156    finish(entry, 0);
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Updates the metadata for an entry.
161   *
162   * @param entry Entry index
163   * @param metadata New metadata for the entry
164   * @param timestamp Time stamp (may be 0 to indicate now)
165   */
166  public void setMetadata(int entry, String metadata, long timestamp) {
167    DataLogJNI.setMetadata(m_impl, entry, metadata, timestamp);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Updates the metadata for an entry.
172   *
173   * @param entry Entry index
174   * @param metadata New metadata for the entry
175   */
176  public void setMetadata(int entry, String metadata) {
177    setMetadata(entry, metadata, 0);
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Appends a record to the log.
182   *
183   * @param entry Entry index, as returned by Start()
184   * @param data Data to record
185   * @param timestamp Time stamp (may be 0 to indicate now)
186   */
187  public void appendRaw(int entry, byte[] data, long timestamp) {
188    DataLogJNI.appendRaw(m_impl, entry, data, timestamp);
189  }
190
191  @Override
192  public void close() {
193    DataLogJNI.close(m_impl);
194    m_impl = 0;
195  }
196
197  public void appendBoolean(int entry, boolean value, long timestamp) {
198    DataLogJNI.appendBoolean(m_impl, entry, value, timestamp);
199  }
200
201  public void appendInteger(int entry, long value, long timestamp) {
202    DataLogJNI.appendInteger(m_impl, entry, value, timestamp);
203  }
204
205  public void appendFloat(int entry, float value, long timestamp) {
206    DataLogJNI.appendFloat(m_impl, entry, value, timestamp);
207  }
208
209  public void appendDouble(int entry, double value, long timestamp) {
210    DataLogJNI.appendDouble(m_impl, entry, value, timestamp);
211  }
212
213  public void appendString(int entry, String value, long timestamp) {
214    DataLogJNI.appendString(m_impl, entry, value, timestamp);
215  }
216
217  public void appendBooleanArray(int entry, boolean[] arr, long timestamp) {
218    DataLogJNI.appendBooleanArray(m_impl, entry, arr, timestamp);
219  }
220
221  public void appendIntegerArray(int entry, long[] arr, long timestamp) {
222    DataLogJNI.appendIntegerArray(m_impl, entry, arr, timestamp);
223  }
224
225  public void appendFloatArray(int entry, float[] arr, long timestamp) {
226    DataLogJNI.appendFloatArray(m_impl, entry, arr, timestamp);
227  }
228
229  public void appendDoubleArray(int entry, double[] arr, long timestamp) {
230    DataLogJNI.appendDoubleArray(m_impl, entry, arr, timestamp);
231  }
232
233  public void appendStringArray(int entry, String[] arr, long timestamp) {
234    DataLogJNI.appendStringArray(m_impl, entry, arr, timestamp);
235  }
236
237  public long getImpl() {
238    return m_impl;
239  }
240
241  private long m_impl;
242}
